intro: Topobea andreana, commonly known as the Andean topobea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
